    Plot colored peptide map

    plot_colored_peptide_map.Rd

    Plot colored peptide map

    plot_colored_peptide_map(
  prot,
  fill_by,
  min_y = 0,
  width_y = 0.025,
  step_y = 0.033,
  border_color = "white",
  border_size = NULL,
  aa_step = 20
)

    Arguments

    prot

    `data.frame` containing peptides from a single protein with columns "First_AA" and "Last_AA".

    fill_by

    character; name of a column in `prot` used to fill the peptide rectangles.

    min_y

    numeric; shifts peptides vertically.

    width_y

    numeric; vertical width of each peptide. Must be less than `step_y`.

    step_y

    numeric; step size to resolve peptide overlaps.

    border_color

    character; color used for the borders of the peptide rectangles.

    border_size

    numeric or `NULL`; linewidth of the borders around the peptide rectangles. If `NULL` (default), the linewidth will be calculated from the protein length.

    aa_step

    numeric; distance between x axis breaks, starting at `aa_step` and continuing along the length of the protein.

    Contents

    Developed by Vladislav Petyuk.
